page.title: 17A YALDING POET: HEALTH
page.content: The late Edmund Blunden, celebrated poet and author, lived in Yalding when young and makes reference to the village in his writings. Members of his family still live in the village and Blunden Lane is named after them. A window in the church engraved by Lawrence Whistler is to his memory. In Yalding there is a family doctor practice with its own pharmacy. There are ante-natal and mother and baby clinics in the village. The nearest hospitals are at Linton and Barming, with an eye hospital at Maidstone. On the outskirts of Yalding, Kenward House is a rehabilitation centre for homeless men, run by the Kenward Trust, a charity. There seems in Yalding to be a higher number than usual of two child families comprising a boy and a girl.
